Name: Deluxe Contagion Survival Kit
Description:
New to Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion? Or are you a veteran Zombie slayer in need of assistance? Here’s your survival kit: it includes everything you need to live through this never-ending horde of Undead, plus room for extra goodies when the time comes. Use it wisely, for those not used to keeping resources plentiful will soon fall victim to a flesh-craving maniac or two…

This deluxe add-on to the base game of Endicott Epidemic includes:

1 large game box insert to hold the base game, expansions, and bits:

88 full-color chipboard chits (pre-punched) 
   45 Player Hit Chits 
   35 Zombie Hit Chits 
    5 Headshot Chits 
    3 Mercenary Chits

2 D6

 6 Exclusive Game Cards:
   1 New Character – Ant 
   1 New Weapon – BFG Minigun
   1 New Zombie Boss – “Military Troll”
   2 New Zombies – “Mo’Hawk” and “Willow II” 
   1 New Event – “Mercenary Assistance” 
 2 Heavyweight play mats: 
   1 Main Game Mat [8.5x14] 
   2 Side Game Mats [4.5x11.5]

1 Expanded rulebook

[Can also be bundled with the ENDICOTT EPIDEMIC: INFECTIOUS CONTAGION core game deck!]

Name: Battles of Westeros: Lords of the River
Description:
Lords of the River introduces House Tully to Battles of Westeros as an ally force, meaning they can supplement House Stark or, if playing with the Skirmish rules, House Lannister from the Core Set. Ally forces such as those found in Lords of the River are represented as tan colored miniatures on the board, differentiating them from the forces of the house they are supporting. This provides greater customization for Skirmish battles and allows players to easily find their allied troops on the field during battle.

Included in Lords of the River are are three new commanders and three new unit types, all loyal to the leaping trout of House Tully. Lead your troops with Edmure Tully, Brynden "Blackfish" Tully, or Marq Piper, and lay waste to your foes with Tully River Riders, Tully Longbowmen, and the Warriors of Wayfarer’s Rest.

New keywords such as Riverborn and Indirect Fire will give you an edge when fighting near rivers or hindering terrain, representing House Tully’s familiarity with fighting in the Riverlands.

In addition to these new forces, Lords of the River also comes with a rules and battle plan book, new terrain, and House Tully Gambit and Skirmish cards. Lords of the River will also be the first expansion to feature the new Battles of Westeros Premium Banners, replacing the cardboard token banners from the Core Set.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Name: Cheddar Challenge
Description: Cheddar Challenge is an abstract game of strategy and skill similar to Chess. Imagine simplified Klingon Chess. Each player has three categories of wedges. Sharp Cheddar, Medium Cheddar and Mild Cheddar. There are specific sizes, numbers of, movements and strengths for each category of wedge. Each category of piece has unique movement and strength. (For example the Mild Cheddar has the greatest number of pieces.) The goal of the game is to win by capturing all wedges comprising one of your opponent's three categories of cheddar. A player will lose if they lose one of their categories. The game is played on a rhombus shaped game board made up of triangluar cells. The theme is fun because its based on cheese and the shapes of cheese wedges. And its much easier to learn and less complicated than Chess or Klingon Chess and can be a great introduction to those games later on.

Name: Alexandriaopoly
Description: Another of the many Monopoly games. This one from Alexandria, Indiana put out by the Alexandria Jaycees. Developed by the THETA TAU Sorority as a fund raising device.

Name: Trek to Zion
Description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Trek to Zion is a non-authorized version of Ticket to Ride.  According to Days of Wonder, Pioneer Plus does not have license to produce this game, thus it is set apart from the official entry of Ticket to Ride.

    


Circle the wagons and gather your friends and family for this exciting new board game! Build the most wagon trains and travel across the United States, visiting the same cities and forts that the pioneers passed in the 1850s. Along the way, set up temples and establish Zion in the crossroads of the West. Whoever blazes the most trails and completes the most treks wins!

This game is pioneer themed clone of Ticket to Ride. It adds a new mechanic of "Temple Blessings" and a new map (of the US), but the rest of the mechanics are the same. Instead of claiming track and placing trains you claim a trail and place covered wagons. Instead of train cards, you have provision cards (Corn, Wheat, Horseshoes, etc.)

Name: Auto Magnetic Pin Spotter Bowling Game
Description:
This game comes from Irwin Co. and is circa 1968.

A regular bowling game that features a reset device so that you do not have to reset the pins yourself. You simply press down on the reset mechanism and the pins are ready for the next frame.

Name: Knot So Fast
Description:
Two players or two teams race to tie the knots pictured on the Knot So Fast challenge cards. After each match, the winners tug a rope in the card holder toward their side. The Knot So Fast Game features 40 knot challenge cards with a little knotty history, a tug of war score keeper, 4 colored ropes and 2 rings. Knot tying is a great skill to master at any age, and with the Knot So Fast Game from ThinkFun, younger players will also be improving their spatial reasoning and manual dexterity! Kids can practice their knots solo or play with 2 or more players, with the Knot So Fast Game!

This is a game about knots. Each player has a piece of rope. Each round, a knot is shown, and each player has to make that knot. When the first player finishes his knot, he announces this, and the other players receive 30 seconds to finish theirs. Then, the finished knots score points.

The first player to reach eight points wins the game. (Or, in the team game, the first team to achieve a sufficiently large lead wins.)

Name: ELSE: spielend gebären
Description:
The name of the game comes from ELective SEstio. This is a C-section for the birth of a child without any medical reasons.

This game is published by the association of midwives as an educational tool against the elective sectio.

First you need to become pregnant so you have to draw a pregnancy card. Then you have to collect different cards for a "normal" birth.

There are several aims of the game mentioned. They are to be interpreted.

First player with a birth wins. Players with the most births win.
Avoid the ELSE card. Last player with ELSE card loses. (This aim is like in Old Maid [Schwarzer Peter])

The game designer confirmed all aims being valid.

Name: Domino-Quartett
Description:
48 square tiles (16 different cards 3 each) are shuffled and every player get 3 in the hand. Starting player put one card on the table and draw one card to have 3 hand-cards.

On your turn you lay a matching tile. Each tile has a triangle in one of the four colors and a triangle with a number 0,1,2 or 3 of dots.

When you finish on 4-tile square you count the dots on the 4 tiles.

After your turn you draw up to 3 cards

End: all cards are played. Player with the most points wins.

Special rule: You can put one tile in front of you if this impossible to lay it. (even if you have a matching tile in your hand) You can use this tile(s) in the following turn(s)

Name: Astrologica
Description:
A GAME MADE OF STARS

Astrology: A way for people to understand the ways of the universe with the help of the stars.

Astrologica is a game in which you can alter Dominant Zodiacs  and  Zodiac Houses along with the Zodiac Elements. 
 The three most important Aspects in Astrology, the Zodiacs, Elements and the Zodiac sky, are yours to arrange and shift.

Players in Astrologica are like Astrologists, argue about the differences astrology has been through over the years. Many cards of the game show that change, from traditional to modern astrology. One of the main reasons, was the discovery of new planets. Until recently, Astrologists weren’t aware of the existence of the planets in the far reaches of our solar system. Due to the discovery of Neptune, Uranus,  Pluto and the consolidation of the Sun centered planetary system, astrology had to change. New ruling planets were established for the Zodiac Signs, Houses were shifted and the characteristics of each sign changed in order to be aligned with the new form of our solar system.

Most of the cards of Astrologica feature these changes, as each player makes the changes available through modern and traditional sign characteristics.

In few words...

Cards help you gain extra points, while creating row of cards 
with the Proper Signs and Elements might grant you victory at the endgame.

As for the players, well, they try to put the Zodiacs in order along with the Elements.

The stars were always there. Our way of observing them through astrology changed, as we discover more and more of the  universe we live in. An easy, competitive game destined for 2-5 players. Enjoy Astrologica by playing and learning of, the universe’s beauty combined with our imagination.

Name: Kuett
Description:
A self published card game similar to UNO. In the deck there are only special cards. +/- shows the next player how many cards to draw (- is only for mathematical if there is already a positive number) if you can not play.
There is also a skip card. Terpentin cards are wild and stop the drawing of cards.

Name: Tortenschlacht
Description:
Translation: Cake-Fight.

Partnership trick-taking game with four suits:
yellow and red cake with numbers
yellow and red flour

You have to follow suit. In the number suit, highest number wins. In the unnumbered suits, tha last card followed suit wins the trick.

Name: Liverpool
Description:
Card game in an "old time game" edition. Similar to Phase 10, but you have 13 phases:
1. 2 sets of 3
2. 1 tun of 4 and 1 set of 3
3. 3 sets of 3
4. 1 run of 5 and 1 set of 4
5. 2 runs of 4 and 1 set of 4
6. 1 run of 6 and 1 set of 5
7. 3 sets of 4
8. 4 sets of 3
9. 2 sets of 6
10. 1 run of 7 and 1 set of 5
11. 1 run of 8 and 1 set of 4
12. 1 run of 10
13. 1 set of 10

On your turn you take a card from the stock or the discard. If you have all your card for the actual phase you can lay them out. If one person gets rid of all hand cards the round ends. "2"s are wild cards.

Name: Slasher
Description:
A fan of horror movies or slasher films? This free print and play is your chance to see how you measure up to the classic greats. Are you the next Jason? Or will the cops end your reign of terror before it begins?

With victims that can fight back, potential news media alerting even more cops to you, and house weapons that can either help or harm you, things won't be as simple as you think.

Gameplay:

Players will use a deck of cards for the game board, and dice and the rules to get things done. Options include cutting lights off in homes, cutting phone lines, trying to fight and kill the victims, as in any slasher film. Of course, when that doesn't go to plan, then you need to decide how to deal with the police, potential survivor types, and other issues. Will you spend a turn rolling to pick up a weapon to help you kill? Or try to rush in and dispatch foes? It's all up to you. This game allows for quite a bit of choice.

Also included are Evil Points, which you earn, and can use to pull off the sorts of narrow escapes, and horror movie classics like escaping unscathed from gunfire.

Lastly, like any good slasher, on a certain roll, you have rage. This unleashes the true horror of your character. You get to create your own within the rules and see how well, and how long you can survive.

-SLASHER KILLER CUT-

This edition is the culmination of 8 years of this game existing, trial and error, pruning rules, and basically gutting my own creation to rewrite it in a much clearer, more concise way. Along with new rules that streamline the game into a faster experience, with more to do. 2 player variants now also included in the rules, along with an Official Character Sheet and Tokens.

Name: Football Legend
Description:
Ground breaking new Football (Soccer) based trivia board game to play with all the family.
All the action of the real game even the referee. Pick your team and formation then test your knowledge to become a Football Legend.

A football  pitch  board and 1 soccer ball as marker, use your special cards and the right answers to move the ball towards to the goal; penalty cards, shoot cards ...referees ...yellow and red cards  are adding a touch of realistic match to the game.

Playing wisely your cards and a good knowledge of football soccer history is the key to win the game.

Name: Starmäng
Description:
Promotional game for Starman (Starman is one the largest provider of cable-TV and internet services in Estonia)

There are 3 different paths in gameboard (cable-TV,internet & phone services) and the objective is move 3 pawns at the end of all paths first.

Contents:

     Gameboard
     4x4 pawns
     1 die

Name: Der Ferien Express
Description:
As a give-away in the seventies, private customers of the insurance company DEVK received a free copy of the game "Der Ferien Express" (the holiday express), probably as a summer gift for the kids.

It is a simple Roll and Move game, with a gambling component.
Players have to supply their own player-tokens, coins, and a die. Only the board game field was given away.

Players roll a die which indicates how far they are allowed to move down the 42 field track trough Europe. If he lands in a black city (Copenhagen, Cadiz, Bern, Athens) the player has to pause for a round and has to pay a coin into the pot (as a hotel fee). If the player lands on a red City (Berlin, London, Paris, Madrid, Venice) he has to pause for a round, but has the chance to take a shortcut when rolling a one on a D6. If he is allowed to take the short cut (express line) he must pay two coins into the pot.

The first player who is back in Berlin receives half the pot, the second and third divide the rest.

Name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 16
Description:
A collection of 12 ASL scenarios designed for tournament play by the Tampa ASL Group.

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader


Contents:
Designer notes and articles. (24 pages)
12 scenarios SP181-192

SP181 - The elefant of surprise
Gagarinka, Ukraine, USSR, 23 July 1943

SP182 - Vlasov's fist
Sachendorf, Germany, 2 March 1945

SP183 - The last full measure
Awacha, Okinawa shima, Rykuyu Islands, 7 May 1945

SP184 - Cornered beasts
Petushki, Ukraine, USSR, 28 June 1941

SP185 - von Renesse's recon
Radekov, Ukraine, USSR, 23 June 1941

SP186 - Beaufort's feast
Crehan, Belgium, 12 May 1940

SP187 - Stairway to heaven
Near Brunete, Spain, 6 July 1937

SP188 - On the road again
Potpot Barrio, Luzon Island, Philippines, 16 January 1945

SP189 - Hell's last issue
Speldrop, Germany, 24 March 1945

SP190 - Bottcher's corner
Buna village, New Guinea, 5 December 1943

SP191 - Tatra salad
Streno, Slovakia, 31 August 1944

SP192 - Rock the csaba
Keteghaza, Hungary, 26 September 1944

Name: Rally Point Volume 5: The Thunderbird Pack
Description:
Rally Point is a series of scenario packs for Advanced Squad Leader. This issue contains 10 scenarios and is a special study of the U.S. Army's 45th Infantry Division

The scenarios are:

RPT41 Sicilian Debut 
Ponte Dirillo, Sicily, 11 July 1943

RPT42 Piccolo Peak
Calore River, Italy, 13 September 1943

RPT43 Thunder in the Valley
Teleset, Italy, 12 October 1943

RPT44 Purple Heart Alley
Venafro, Italy, 4 November 1943

RPT45 Operation Buffalo
Campoleone Station, Italy, 23 May 1944

RPT46 Ghosts of Meximieux
Meximieux, France, 1 September 1944

RPT47 Black Edelweiss
Reipertswiller, France, 16 January 1945

RPT48 Firestorm
Aschaffenburg, Germany, 29 March 1945

RPT49 Spring Cleaning
Bamberg, Germany, 12 April 1945

RPT50 Nazi Town
Nürnberg, Germany, 17 April 1945

Name: Who'd You Rather?
Description:
Who'd You Rather - The Ultimate Adult Party Game

In this game you attempt to be the first player to reach $1 Million by performing risque activities or by betting on the sexual preferences of other players in the following categories (as taken from the rules):

1. Pics - Some are hot, some are not - but you must choose one!
2. Celebs: This category compares two well-known celebrities.
3. Turn Ons/Turn Offs: This category is all about the things that might get you excited...or disgusted!
4. Down and Dirty: This category lets it all out.  This is where other find out what you're really about - between the sheets, that is.
5. Anything Goes: This is the action category.  You'll get to see people do things you never really thought they would do.

Each turn, The active player spins to see which category they must follow.  They will then be asked to perform the action required to earn cash, or select their preference of two options (A or B) presented.  They choose between A or B and place their answer card face-down in front of them.  All other players also place an answer card in front of themselves with the answer they think the active player chose.  Bets may be placed on answers to increase the money earned by a correct guess.  The active player must reveal their answer and explain themselves.  All correct players earn $50K plus whatever they bet.  Incorrect players lose any money they wagered.

The game includes different pics/question card sets for people who prefer men and people who prefer women.

Name: Schnuffi, wuff!
Description:
The game consists of a special die and a set of tiles. These depict things that dogs do (sniff, pee, run, etc.). In the basic game, the children take turns picking up a card and acting out the action. Then they can keep the tile. At the end of the game, the player with most different card colors is the winner.

In a competitive variant, the players take turns rolling the die. A player rolling a dog symbol can pick up cards and act out the pictures and keep the tiles until another player rolls the dog symbol. The player with most tiles at the end of the game is the winner.

(user summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Geschenke aus Gottes Hand
Description:
Card game where the player with the fastest reaction wins.

In the game there are 12 different "pairs" like: cow --> milk or hen --> egg. The first cards ist called start, the second gift (from god). Every player has a set of 12 gift card oppen in front of him. Now 1 start card is turned over an all players (wihtout the player turn over), try to find the matching gift card first to win the start card. After all 36 start card are played, the player with the most card earned wins.

Name: Kommissar Rex: Wer stahl den Kohinoor?
Description:
Row of four cards (A,B,C and D) should be built in the center of the table. On your turn you can play one of your 6 handcards. Start a row with an A or build on en existing row. On the card there are colored lines. A card can only be added if it has the same color as the last card of the row.
There are also jokers.
The player laying a D card gets the row as points and a player who can exchange a joker get the point for the exchanged card.

This is branded with the sheperd dog "Rex" from the TV show "Kommissar Rex"

Name: Würfel-Wörter
Description:
Five dice with letters are rolled. Now every player tries to build a word only with thes five letter, bur can use the five letters as often as they wish. The player rolled can use one joker letter.

Write down your word an put it in the game box. If all players but one wrote down a word the words will be scored. Each word is one point per letter plus a bonus for beeing fast.

Name: Stockholmsspelet Utbyggnadspaket 2007
Description:
Expansion for Stockholmsspelet.
Contains 500 new questions and 8 new player characters.

Name: Dragon Surprise
Description:
A memory game. One player has the green knights, the other the blue knights. In your turn you first have to turn over a knight in your color. If not just turn hide the card and next player's turn. If you find your knight, you turn over cards as long as you find a dragon. Then a fight will happen. You roll dice for your knight and the other player for the dragon. For a killed dragon you get a treasure.

This game is limited to 100 copies.

Name: Enlightened Warlords: A Player's Guide to Soldier Kings
Description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

"Enlightened Warlords is a 64-page book supplement for Soldier Kings, our multi-player game of the Seven Years’ War. It includes game strategy for all eight Major Powers, a history of the Seven Years’ War, and a number of new variants to spice up your game:


     National Aspirations. Austria can win the game by capturing Martinique — but Maria Theresa wanted Silesia, not some Caribbean island, no matter how valuable it might be. Each Major Power receives a new set of national objectives unique to itself and usually conflicting with someone else’s goals.



     Special Powers. Prussian counterfeiting, France’s free press, Austria’s Military Border and much more. Each Major Power becomes even more unique in play.



     Pre-War Options: Habsburg Spain, the Maratha Empire, Bonnie Price Charlie. How would each of these unusual events have impacted the next generation?



     And Lots More Options: Tropical diseases, national finance limits, supply, capital cities and on and on."

Name: Brainline
Description: A two player abstract game played on a 7 by 9 array of hexes. Each player has four pegs of his colour on the specified starting hexes. On his turn a player may move any one of his pegs any distance in a straight line but may not jump any other peg. The object of the game is to be the first to get all four pegs of your colour in a straight line. They do not have to be adjacent but there must be no opponent pegs between them.

Name: Letter Heads
Description:
Four different letters games can be played with the components included in the box:

1) Letter puzzle - longest possible word  (Deal 9 letters onto table and all players use these letters to find the longest possible word.  Players get 1 point for every letter in their word.)

2) Word builder - create as many words as possible using 3 random letters  (Deal 3 letters onto table and players have 1 minute to create as many words as possible containing these letters.  Players get 1 point for ever unique word they come up with.)

3) Word paths - search for words in a four by four grid  (Create a random 4 by 4 grid of letters and players then find as many words as possible in the grid, similar to Boggle.  Players gain 1 point for each unique word they find.)

4) Word crossing - use as many letters to make a crossword layout  (Players are dealt 21 letters and have 5 minutes to create a crossword grid using these letters.  Each player scores as many points as letters they use.)

Name: Paradox
Description:
This is a very strange card game. In the deck are 8 cards of this values: +1,+2,+3,+4,-2,-3.
Shuffle the deck an everybody gets 4 cards. Turn over the deck and do what the card says. If it is a positive card you as many cards from this deck. If it is a negative card you discard that number to the discard pile and add the negative card. When the deck runs out turn over the discard pile and go on. When all card are in the players hands, all positive cards count negative and the negative cards count zero.

Name: Mario Madness
Description: Super Mario Bros branded card game. A mixture of rummy and canasta. You have to collect set and straits to get points. There are also some special cards.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Monster Trix
Description: Super Marion Bros. branded card game. On the cards there are Monster in different numbers. All players turn over one card from their own deck at the same time. If there are 6 or more monsters of the same kind, you have to slam pn the table to get all open cards. If you run out of cards you are out.

Name: blau - gelb - rot - ...
Description:
The smallest memory game ever. There are three discs, each with a different color underneath: blue, yellow or red.
You roll a die (blue, blue, yellow, yellow, red, red).
You show the disc with this color and put the disc somewhere back on the table. If you choose the wrong one you have lost.
Surprisingly someone will make a mistake. Should be played really fast.

Name: UNO: England FA
Description: An England Football edition of UNO with 112 custom cards featuring England players.  In addition to the normal UNO cards, there is the "Goal" card which allows players to swap a card with another player.

Name: jUX
Description: The board constist of two long rectangles forming a "X" and an "U". On your turn you add a piece in your color at the end of the "X" or the "U" or the cente of the "U". When all spaces are filled you get a point for each majority of the rectangles of the "X" and the "U". Most points win.

Name: Orthogo
Description:
The board is a square seperated by othogonal lines with 24 crossing points. The are pieces in three different colors. At the start you have to put 2 pieces of each color on the board, so that not two of the same color are adjacent. Each player gets 6 starting pieces.

On a turn you have to put a piece adjecent to one of the same color and then you have to move the adjacten same colored pieces. If there is a piece on the space you have to move to, this piece is beaten. You have to take on of the beaten pieces back.

The player who got rid of all his pieces first is the winner.

Name: Schätzinsel
Description:
In front of the island of Pirate Fishbeard lies the ship of some other pirates. They want to steal the gold from Fishbeard. But the slope of the pirates is so unstable that it can fall over. Each player has to remember how heavy the gold boxes are so that they don't make the slope fall over whenever the pirates transport the gold to their ships!

Children can learn to add up and subtract weights with this game.

Name: Sally
Description: A memory game with 4 different ways to play. There are 48 different cards in 6 different colors and different numbers. In one variant you have to find a card in the color roll with a colored die, in another you have to build a sum rolled with a d10.

Name: Bluffi
Description:
A memory, bluff racing game. A racing track is built with 24 tiles. The tiles are hidden on the hidden side are values: -3,-2,-1,+1,+2,+3,+4. 
On a game board are 8 other hidden tiles with dice values 1,1,2,2,3,3,4,4.
On your turn you turn over one of the dice tiles and move your pawn the number showing and put the dice tile in another storage. Then take the tile you are landing on and look secretly what is on it. Now you declare what you have seen an move according to what you said. 
If another player does not believe you he can call you bluff and the tile is shown. Whoever is wrong has to move 5 spaces back.
After 8 turns the dice tile sotrage is gone and now we play with the other storage.

Name: Pang-Dang
Description:
40 cards with circles on them divided into 12 parts. Each part is colored in one of the six colors lay on the table.

One of the other 40 cards (exactely the same but a bit larger) is revealed and you have to find the matching cards fastest.

Name: Amok
Description:
Every player is a street-builder adn tries to build new streets. But every player has also his own spaces he tries not to be overbuild. The players try to overbuild the other players' spaces.

In the game there is normal movement, but also "Amok" movement. If you are in a rush hour you will go amok and now it is easier to build new street in your rampage.

This is a last man standing (means last player with noch overbuilt spaces) game.

Name: Unterwegs mit Paulus
Description:
This is a biblical cooperative game, where the players try to form new christian societies while traveling through the eastern mediterranean.

When all players are die or imprisoned the game ends and you score how man societies you have build.

Name: Cycle Tour
Description:
Free-download cycling game made in Melbourne (Australia). The pdf provides game board, player tokens, chance cards and shopping cards, and you will need to supply a regular deck of cards from which you will remove the jacks, 3's,and 2's, as well as the jokers.

Players use the cards to move their pieces around the board and collect shopping cards as they fall on green squares. Blue squares are special “chance squares” where players get cards.

There are 2 winners in this game, the person who completes 5 laps first and the person who has the highest value of shopping when they finish 5 laps.

Name: Charisma
Description:
Setup:     Charisma can be played on various sized boards.  A 6x6x6 or 7x7x7 hex hex board is recommended.  Each player has a plentiful amount of their own colored pieces.

Goal:    The player with the largest group wins.  If tied then another equal or second largest group wins etc...

Turn:    Place one of your pieces on the board or strike with one already placed.  If you cannot do either then you must pass. Passing is otherwise not permitted.

    Place:    
        one stone anywhere on the board not adjacent to any other stone.
    
    Strike:
        The striking stone moves in a straight line and may not  pass through any other stone.
        The strike value must be equal to the number of stones in the target group.
        strike value = number of spaces moved + number of stones in the group(s) adjacent to the departed space.
        Upon striking, the target group is converted to the color of the striking stone.
    


End:    when both players consecutively pass or when it’s clear who will have the biggest group.

Name: Battle of Cannae
Description:
"Battle of Cannae" is the 3rd postcard wargame published by Formosa Force Game in 2011. It simulates the "Battle of Cannae" in 216BC.

Components:
Two players lead 11 Roman units and 7 Carthage units respectively. The battlefield is a 6X9 grids map. There are three kinds of soldiers including cavalry, heavy infantry, and light infantry.

Sequence of play:
Two players do actions alternatively. The Carthage player act first. He need to move all units and then units next to enemy units can attack. In each battle, two players roll 1D6 and add the unit combat value. The difference of the result determine which side needs to retreat or flip the counter. The cavalry unit can move for 3 grids and infantry can move for 1 grid.

Victory condition:
Player who eliminates half of opponent's army win the game immediately.

Name: Artificers
Description:
Overview:
Players are skilled artificers trying to purchase the best components to make the most deadly gladiator weapon the world has ever seen.  The game takes place in two rounds.  In the first round the players compete in a shrewd auction to get the components they need.  In the second round, the players build their weapons and battle to decide the winner.

Components:
1 pack of A-Type Nestoriles (60 tiles in 10 colors)

Name: Le Jeu du Labyrinthe
Description:
Easy abstract maze game. Every player start with 4 pawns in one of the four corners. On the board there are lying pieces (shaped like in Blokus).

On your turn you can do both of two actions in the order you like:
1. move one of your pawns as far as you like in an orthogonal direction, blocked by obstacles.
2. move 1 piece as far as you like in orthogonal direction.

The first player having 3 pawn on the nine center spaces wins.

Name: Sniper
Description:
Named after a dutch tv-series.

Every player gets a secret mission (winning condition). It is eleminating another player or taking over a part of the city. One piece of each player (the sniper) can be moved hidden. The rest is roll-and-move.

Name: DataMan
Description:
DataMan is an space themed educational game that comes with a "DataMan calculator", 12 cards and 4 dual sided boards. Each of the 12 cards are printed with sepecific instructions that explain how to set up the the "calculator" for differant games. 
The four boards generaly feature a geometric play area as well as instructions for more complicated games.

The DataMan story is generally based around three characters: DataMan, Commander NumberFun and AntiMath. DataMan is a small robot designed by Commander NumberFun who is a ruler of a far away planet. AntiMath is an "Evil wizard from a dark star who has a mysterous power to cloud the minds of his victims and steal away the fun and excitement of mathematics."

Name: Triquetra
Description:
This game is played on a 12 x 12 field, with some squares colored and some grey. The players have 2 chieftains, 4 druids and 12 warriors each. Each type of pawn has its own movement rules. The goal is to reach the opponent's end zone with two chieftains or warriors. 
The colored squares are either danger fields or trigger fields. If a pawn is on a danger field and the opposing player can move a pawn into the corresponding trigger field, the pawn on the danger field is destroyed.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Fill in the "Bleep"
Description: Fill in the Bleep is the single answer card game that creates a thousand laughs. Players are dealt BLEEP cards and are presented a sentence with a missing word. Players then fill in the blank with their best BLEEP card based on the die roll, (Funniest, Quirkiest, Choice). The dealer will then Fill in the BLEEP with the best submission. But beware of action cards that can change the game in an instant. Be the first to get rid of all of your BLEEP cards and you WIN! Fill in the Bleep will bring brow raising, crazy, zany far out fun.

Name: Loaded Questions: Pop Culture
Description:
In this hilarious game where everyone's a critic, laugh, chat, and play away with 200 NEW creative questions on movies, music, television, celebrities, and all things pop culture.

Loaded Questions Pop Culture, just like the original and various versions, tests how well players know one another. It is the perfect game for anyone who loves movies, books or television. Questions include "If you ran a celebrity zoo, who would be your star attraction?" and "Which millionaire would you like to get a Christmas check from?" Matching people with their answers will score points for you. Loaded Questions Pop Culture comes with 200 new and hilarious questions that your family will love. You can play with enclosed components or the original game (original game sold separately)

Name: Miam
Description:
In Miam, players are merchants who are buying food stuffs at market, then selling them for cash, with more goods of the same type bringing a bigger payout. Whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins.

To set up the game, one player shuffles the 55-card deck – which consists of eleven categories of food (bread, pasta, cheese, etc.) with four cards in each category, four jokers, and seven special action cards – then spreads out the cards face down on the table. Each player starts with five money.

On a turn, a player uses special cards (optional), turns two cards face up, keeps one of these cards while flipping the other face down, sells sets of food cards (optional), and auctions cards on hand to other players (optional). The special cards, which are claimed like any other, allow a player to steal one card from an opponent or keep both cards revealed that turn. When a player sells a set of food cards, she receives 2-16 money for selling 2-5 cards of the same type; these cards are then removed from play. A player can auction any number of cards, with opponents bidding in round-robin fashion for the entire lot.

Once the last card has been claimed from the table, the game lasts three more rounds with players being able to take only the optional actions listed above: using special cards, selling sets, and auctioning cards.

Name: Carrera Ciclista
Description:
Strange cycling board game because during the race the cyclists also switch to air movement (via either a balloon, slow or fast air plane) and travel over water (via a rowing boat, 2 normal boats and a hovercraft) between the tracks. The cyclist who arrives first in the port can choose which boat he chooses and thus move faster over the water to the final cyclist track. So this is a race game over land, air & water. The player who reaches the finish in Chiromo Village wins the game.

From the book The KnowHow Book of Action Games.

Name: Il Grande Gioco del Giro d'Italia
Description: Very simple roll & move cycling game published in July 1973. It was based on the Tour of Italy, on the board you start in Belgium , travel through Germany & Switzerland with the final and largest part of the race in Italy. The game comes with four cardboard riders and two dice.

Name: Cyclo Tour
Description:
French self-produced cycling game that features a couple of two-faced boards whith which you can make four different tracks, four teams of four riders (some of them hand painted, though monochrome), an extra yellow jersey rider (to replace the leader in stage races), a set of tactic/chance cards, a couple of dice, some markers, a classification sheet and a set of rules.

On your turn you divide your dice throw among the riders, maximum four points per rider; you cannot win the race unles all your riders have reached a certain 'hot' point in the race; you have to play inmediately chance cards but you can keep tactic cards (you take a card for each rider that finishes his move in red fields).

Strange is that the riders also have to pass barriers and gates. The game is played over several stages. In each stage points can be scored depending on your result in that stage. After all stages have been completed the total from all stages is added up to determine the winner.

Name: Moody
Description:
Be the player who's secret mission card is closest to the mood marker after the character reaches the mood wheel.

Each player is a daemon that guides and influences the main character. The game is a struggle between daemons to control main character's spiritual state or his mood by using the environment surrounding the character. Daemons take turns playing cards to trigger the environment or some of it's aspects to shift the character's mood, advance the character to next section or to change the environment all together. Each player's actions directly affect decisions and strategy of the other players. Game ends when the main character jumps into the mood wheel.

Name: Colonial Battlefleet: Man vs. Machine
Description:
From the product description:

Colonial Battlefleet: Man vs. Machine is the first fleet book supplement for the Colonial Battlefleet tactical starship combat core rules. This supplement provides new rules and options to tailor your Colonial Battlefleet game to a new setting. In this setting artificially intelligent machines have succeeded in wiping out all human life on the planet Earth. The machine intelligence now seeks to do the same to offworld human colonies that have been out of touch with Earth for millennia.

Name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Chaos Moon
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of The Chaos Moon, the second Battle Pack installment of The Morrslieb Cycle! This 60 card pack contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.

In The Chaos Moon, the Dwarf brewer Josef Bugman brings his legendary ale to the hold, while the High Elves deliver the wrath of the massive Moon Dragon and the Empire’s wizards control the very forces of nature. Meanwhile, Papa Nurgle inflicts a horrific new disease upon the Old World, frenzying Witch Elves bathe themselves in blood, and the Orcs bash everything in sight!

And all the while, the enigmatic Wood Elves watch from the forests...
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Warhammer Invasion – Living Card Game

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Initiations of the Favored Asylum Pack
Description:
Initiations of the Favored is the third Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. This cycle introduces new Monsters, Servitors, Rituals, and Items, as well as cards for the Order of the Silver Twilight. The story of Lucy Jennings, Silver Twilight initiate, continues in the serial tale by Jeff Tidball.

Initiations of the Favored is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Journey to Extinction Island
Description:
User summary:

This game is part of the Gone Extinct Groovy Tube Book published by innovativeKids. It consists of a hardcover book, a tube of plastic animals, and a game board in the attached box. The book describes various extinct animals, including the plastic animals it comes with, and the game rules are on the last couple pages of the book.

Journey to Extinction Island is a roll-and-move game that has 2-4 players traveling several small paths to collect specimens from each zone (Water, Flyers, Forest and Swamp), while avoiding poachers. The first player to collect one of each type and make it through the final zone (the poacher camp) wins the game.

Name: Planeta Barça
Description:
A Trivial-like game on all facts and history about the soccer team Futbol Club Barcelona, 'Barça'. As in Trivial Pursuit, players advance along the board tracks by correctly answering questions. The first player gathering six trophies will be the winner.

Questions come in six different categories:
- History
- Players, coaches and presidents
- Trivia
- Matches and biography
- Images
- Non-soccer teams

Game components:
- 1 gameboard
- 6 tokens
- 1 die
- 298 question cards, with more than 2,500 questions
- 2 cards
- 36 trophies
- Rulebook

Name: Divine
Description:
Divine is a game for 2 to 4 players in which you assume the role of a Deity trying to spread their religion in ancient times. You can use your divine powers to quickly gain followers or deviously attack your competing religions. Priests, Zealots, Prophets, and Avatars are your pawns of strategic influence in a developing city which you must control.

The game board consists of 9 tiles that are randomly placed at the beginning of the game to represent an ancient city. Each tile consists of a 36 square grid that depicts various special locations within the city. Players start by controlling a single temple that allows them to train either Priests or Zealots. Priests can preach to gain followers based on the population of each spot on the game board; however, they are vulnerable to be assassinated by an opponent's Zealot. Priests can also establish new temples throughout the city, which can also be desecrated and destroyed by an opponent's Zealot. Unit movement is dictated by multiple dice rolls equal to the number of temples you control.

Players can use divinity cards from their hand to change the outcome of certain scenarios. More powerful units like Prophets and Avatars can only be created by using specific divinity cards. By taking control of special spaces on the board players can also receive additional bonuses.

To win the game players must carefully choose a win condition to work towards. A player wins the game if they are the first to 1) amass 100 follower tokens or 2) capture all 4 tower spaces or 3) be the only remaining player with a temple.

Name: HTPsim
Description: Simulation of a cycling race. It is possible to play a simulation of a stage race with multiple stages. Typically the length of a stage will vary between 150 and 200 spaces. Movement in the game is determined by the position of the riders in the peloton. A peloton typically consists of 10 teams with each 3 riders.

Name: Le Petit Vélodrome
Description: French board game about indoor cycling, it comes with 3 dice and a board with a metal frame. It is unknown when this game was produced.

Name: Rouleur
Description: Cycling game where the goal is to advance riders depending on the dice rolls (there also is one black die) and on the use of energy cards. There are 5 cyclists numbered from 1 to 5. Each team has one control board where pins can be sticked in. The game is also played with a deck of 200 energy cards, there are 5 different energy cards.

Name: Keirin
Description:
This game is a simulation of a Keirin indoor track cycling race although it can in theory be played with multiple players who can place bets on the outcome of the race. Keirin is a sport where the riders are following a derny (a motorcycle) before they are released in their race. The game is played with 6 riders and 6 different colours and a derny, multiple coloured dice and a track of 60 squares long.

In 2012, Anki added a Print and Play update. The main differences are:

a) There are 9 racers now, like real in keirin races, instead of six. However, for a shorter game, you can drop some riders (the ones with the highest numbers). Playing with 6, 7 or 8 riders is ok.

b) You do not need a lot of different coloured dice. You just need as many dice as racers, that is, nine dice.

c) The motorbike now takes part in the game, even if it's just in the first turn. It is not there "just for the ambiance" anymore.  The rule foir the first throw of rider 1 has also changed.

Name: Ultra Quick Soccer
Description:
The scope of Ultra Quick Soccer is much like the other games in the Ultra Quick lineup. With UQ Soccer, I aim to provide you with an extremely quick and accurate method of resolving the final score between two soccer teams. With UQ Soccer you can play out an entire season for a team or a league in rapid fashion. UQ Soccer makes a perfect stand-alone game for season replays. It also functions very well as a complimentary game by resolving the games that don’t particularly interest you in a detailed shot-by-shot game, while you use the detailed game to play out the games that do interest you. 
Unlike most quick play games, which only provide a team score, UQ Soccer does offer an optional individual scoring module to allow you to track league leaders in goals and assists in leagues that track the stat. There is also an individual goal keeper option for some seasons which will allow you to track goal keeper Wins and Losses as well as GAA.

Name: Boggin'
Description:
Experience all of the drama and excitement of professional Mud Bog Racing with Boggin'.

Boggin' includes 21 of the best Modified trucks from all over the world.

Boggin' simulates every facet of the sport from mechanical failures to full runs.

Mud bogging, also known as mud racing, is a form of off-road motor sport popular in the United States in which the goal is to drive a vehicle through a pit of mud of a set length. Winners are determined by the distance traveled through the pit or, if several vehicles are able to travel the entire length, the time taken to traverse the pit. Typically, vehicles competing in mud bogs are four-wheel drives.

There are many types of mud bogs. From Hill and Hole, Flat or Progressive Track, and Open Bog. They come in many shapes and sizes from 150 feet to over 300 feet. Hill and Hole is just as it sounds, usually is 60 feet wide 200 feet long and is a series of hills and holes, and make challenging to each truck. Progressive tracks are generally flat with the consistency of the mud varying as the vehicle advances through the pit.

Boggin' features 24 of the best mud bogs in the world. And each is uniquely rated for length, type and difficulty.

You need not be an expert or even a full-fledged fan of mud bogging to enjoy the game. Everything needed to "bring you up to speed" is included in the rule book. Even those with no knowledge of the sport itself will love this racing game.

Name: BattleTech: Cranston Snord's Irregulars
Description:
From the back cover
“ Cranston Snord's Irregulars have widely different reputations, depending on who you ask. Katrina Steiner thinks of the unit as one of the most effective, if unorthodox, units in her employ. House Marik would like to rid the Inner Sphere of the unit and has been trying for many years. Jaime Wolf sees the unit as a band of looters who have made good. One way or the other, the Irregulars are probably best known for their ability to get into and out of tight spots created by their never-ending quest for the lost artifacts and/or treasures of Mankind's past. Whether called looters or not, they are still a unit to be reckoned with.

This scenario set details the history of Snord's Irregulars, profiles the statistics and conditions of it members and the company 'Mechs, and includes 14 scenarios pitting the Irregulars against the wide variety of opponents they have fought throughout their colorful past. Also described are some of their more memorable treasure hunting expeditions.”

Name: The Fox's Teeth: Exploits of McKinnon's Raiders
Description:
From the back of the book:

"The mercenary company McKinnon's Raiders was nicknamed "The Fox's Teeth" for their long and successful history in carrying out the policies of Hanse "The Fox" Davion. Now considered a house unit of the House of Davion, the most powerful of the Successor States, McKinnon's Raiders has a remarkable history of loyalty under the most trying of circumstances.

This scenario set details the history of McKinnon's Raiders, profiles the statistics and condition of the members of the company and includes 14 scenarios pitting the Raiders against the wide variety of opponents they have fought throughout their colorful past."

Name: BattleTech: Tales of the Black Widow Company
Description:
rom the back of the book:

"This supplement is packed with descriptions of one of BattleTech's most elite fighting companies: The Black Widow Company of Wolf's Dragoons. Selling their services to the highest bidder, this mercenary unit is well known throughout the Successor States. Included is a history of the Black Widow Company and her commander, Natasha Kerensky, details of the units that make up the company and the MechWarriors who do the fighting, plus 15 scenarios of actual engagements fought by the Black Widow."

Name: Giro Ciclistico d'Italia
Description: Italian cycling game from just after WWII about the Tour of Italy. It uses roll & move mechanics but technically it's not a race game because the winner is not the player who reaches the final square on the board first but the player scored the most of points on the track.

Name: Bicross
Description: This French cycling game for children was given as a bonus in april 1986 with the French Picsou magazine. It was the third and last of their cycling series (the other two being  Picsoutour and Pic-Etape). This time we have a free-style race. The best thing of this one is that the track is three-dimensional. As can be expected, landing on downhill squares is better than landing on uphill ones!

Name: 6 day Bike Race
Description: This game is unique because it's a self destructing game! The game was published with six paper boards that self destruct after you play the game! It has a cycling theme, the mechanic is that you have to touch with a burning cigarette the starting line of the cyclist, the line of the rider that's burned up first is the rider that wins the game.

Name: Radrennen
Description:
German cycling game that features 4 double sided board with multiple tracks for road cycling, track cycling and time trial. It's a dice game but it doesn't use regular dice. Instead it provides 6 different-coloured modified D6s.

Teams are composed of 5 riders (6 teams provided, plus some riders with special jerseys: rainbow, yellow, pink, green and  polka-dot (the last one is the jersey for the German national champion).

There are rules for one day races and for stage races, including rules for time trials, team time trials, and even the prologue, as well as rules for 11 different track races!

Name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Klendathu Invasion
Description:
From the back cover,

"The Homeworld of the Arachnid menace has been located and the Mobile Infantry has been moved into position to strike -- are you ready to join the greatest battle Mankind has ever initiated?

Klendathu Invasion is the largest combined fleet and Mobile Infantry operation of the Arachnid War to date.

Within these covers:

Invasion: The story of Starship Troopers continues, from intitial preparations for invasion to the final retreat.

Army Lists: The Mobile Infantry gains the use of the huge invasion companies, while the Arachnids fight back with cunning traps and tunnel systems.

Fighting on Klendathu: Determine the fate of your own Mobile Infantry company during the invasion in a complete campaign."

Name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Arachnid Army Book
Description:
From the back cover,

"Bugs. Arachnids. Call them what you will, they are the greatest and most terrifying threat Mankind has ever faced. A species so utterly ruthless and alien that they are beyond comprehension. The Arachnid Army Book takes this most compelling threat and reveals a level of detail never before seein inprint."

The Arachnid Army Book provides detailed background, new rules and new unit types for Bug forces in the Starship Troopers miniature game.

Name: Zigurat
Description:
For millennia, two clans have held the balance of power in the Zigurat. Now, the day of the rebellion has come  and the two sides face to conquer the pyramid. Each clan has priests and colossal guardians to carry out the mission.
The first to crown the top of the Zigurat will rule over everything.

Zigurat is an abstract game for 2 players, which will have to move their Priests and Guardians by a three-dimensional board representing a Mesopotamic ziggurat.

Durante milenios, dos clanes han mantenido el equilibrio de poder en el Zigurat. Ahora, ha llegado el día de la rebelión y los dos bandos se enfrentan para conquistar la pirámide. Cada clan cuenta con sacerdotes y colosales guardianes para llevar a cabo la misión. El primero que consiga coronar la cima del Zigurat dominará sobre todo.

Zigurat es un juego abstracto para 2 jugadores, los cuales tendrán que mover a sus Sacerdotes y Guardianes por un tablero tridimensional que representa un zigurat.

Name: Confrontation: Creatures of Dirz Army Book
Description:
From the back cover,

"The Army Book: Creatures of Dirz is a supplement for Confrontation: The AGe of Rag'Narok. It contains everything you need to playwith or battle against the alchemical laboratories of the Scorpion."

Name: Confrontation: Wolfen Army Book
Description:
From the back cover,

"The Army Book: Wolfen is a supplement for Confrontation: the Age of Rag'narok. It contains everything you need to play with or battle against the sedentary packs (Wolf)"

Name: Who Gets the Cheese?
Description:
Feeling particularly confident in his speed one day, a mouse brought a challenge to his unlikely friend, a kitty. The mouse would attempt to capture as many pieces of the cheese placed throughout the house as he could without being caught. However, if the kitty manages to catch him, he'll have to give up one of his six shiny trinkets for the kitty to wear. Let the competition begin!

Game Play:
Play starts with the first player turning over the top card of his face-down Draw Pile and placing the card face up in the center of the table. This card starts the Play Pile for the game. The type of card that is played will determine the sequence of actions that takes place next. As soon as all 6 Kitty Pawns are awarded, the game ends. Each player then counts up his or her combined cards and Kitty Pawns. The player with the most combined cards and Kitty Pawns is the winner!

Name: Honey Comb
Description:
Save the Bee

This game plays like "Don't Break the Ice", but it's vertically oriented. Players take turns spinning a spinner determine which color 'block' they are going to knock out of the honeycomb, which destabilizes the whole setup. The first person to drop the bee sitting on top of the honeycomb loses.

Name: Through the Clues
Description: Through the Clues is a great new word game with a twist! You can only believe half of what you see! Players guess words based on a series of two word clues…but only one of the words in each two word clue is meaningful, the other is a decoy. Players' alternate turns writing a series of five distracting two word clues for all their opponents who are trying to find the common link between the clues and then guess the answer. Guessing begins as soon as the first two word clue is placed in the easel. Play continues until all five easel cards are placed in the easel. If the no one answers the word in the allotted time, the clue giver scores the points. With 300 answer words complete with clues/decoys listed and the option to make up your own decoys, there is no limit to the fun.

Name: Das Müllspiel
Description:
An educational game for groups about pollution. 1/3 of the players are farmer and the others are industry-people. Everybody needs each turn one food and one industrial product. Without one food the player is out of the game. Also everybody is produce one garbage each turn and the pollution starts.

The players can trade freely with each other.
The game ends after 10 turns. One winner will determined depending on how much one owns.

But the goal should be (educational) not to loose any player in the game.

Name: Spartuna
Description:
Monopoly-Style game branded for the "Sparkasse Osterholz Scharmbeck". In the game you try to get the most victory points. Money is just worth one VP each, debts are minus and you get VP for your career. All players are workers in the bank you start from "clerk" and can end as director.

Game end after one player is a director

Name: Convoy
Description: Every player has a convoy of 7 pawns in one corner of the board. On your turn you roll one d6. You can move one of your pawns the exact number. You can only move if there are at most 3 empty spaces between your 7 pawns. You can move over your own pawns, but opponent's pawns are blocking.

Name: CrossOver
Description:
Maze game published by the game store chain "Vedes" with a special mechanic.

Every player has 4 pawns in his corner and tries to get to the opposite corner with all his pawns. The board is just a square grid and you can move all your pawns as far as you like without crossing a black line. After this movement you can change the board. The black lines are printed on two clear plastic layers under the clear game board. You can move the clear plastic under the board in one of the four directions and make another movement with all your pawns.
Opponent's pawns are blocking.

Name: Binge
Description:
From the rulebook:
The object of the game is to go out drinking and to come home "happy". Each drink carries a certain number of points, and the winner of the game is the first player to get home to bed with a hundred point or more, i.e. happy. But there is more to the game than simply stopping at a pub (bar) and drinking. A player must have a drink in at least 8 different bars to win. He must also consider the activities of the other drinkers, who may hiner his progress by throwing up, bumping into him, or even drinking bars dry....
A special rule in the game is that you get less and less movement point the more and more drinking points you get.

Name: Juego Carreras de Ciclismo
Description: Spanish free downloadable cycling themed card game that works with movement and incident cards. The goal is to win the cycling race by tactical use of the cards.

Name: Colin Miroir
Description: Original memory game where players on their turn can taken and look under one of the thick wooden tiles to find matching pawns. Below the wooden tiles (there are 84 of them) is a mirror that reflects an image. The winner at the end of the game is the played who found the most matching pawns.

Name: 5 Colonnes à la une
Description:
According to popular believe Wolfgang Kramer was supposed to be the first designer who introduced a points scoring track (Kramerleiste) around the board with his game Heimlich & Co.

But this French game published back in 1961 already had such a points scoring track over 20 years earlier which makes this possibly the first game to implement this.

In the game each player plays a journalist trying to get the best stories whilst traveling from city to city on the board that depicts a map of the world. The game used beautiful cards depicting either countries, historical events or historical figures from that era such as General de Gaulle, the Pope, president Kennedy or Kroutchov.

Name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Shadow & Flame
Description:
From the back cover,

"This supplement is an invaluable guide to collecting, painting and gaming with Games Workshop's detailed The Lord of the Rings miniatures.

RULES:
The complete rules for Balin and his Dwarves, together with some of their enemies -- Durburz, the Goblin King of Moria, and the Goblin Drums. The appendices also cover Tom Bombadil, the Barrow-wights, Glorfindel,Radagast the Brown and much more.

SCENARIOS:
Four linked scenarios recreate the epic struggle of the Dwarves against the Goblins and the mighty Balrog. In the appendices, three different scenarios that cover other exciting clashes between the foreces of Good and Evil in Rivendell, the Barrow-downs and Fangorn forest.

PAINTING TIPS:
Detailed advice on how to paint the Dwarves in The Lord of The Rings strategy battle game, together with inspiring photographs of all the new models and scenery that have been designed for this book"
Families: Series: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game (Games Workshop)

Name: Ascot
Description:
Horse game with a Game board with two Boards on it: 1 racing course and 2 business course.

Each player start in his first business course and advance via the second to the third. For each course there are different event cards.

Two times in the game the horses race. You try to make the most money

Name: Karten-Roulett
Description:
A game board with a track shaped like an "8". I both "holes" there are each one disc (gameboard parts) that can be turned.

Every player get a set of 8 cards and plays one in each turn to get on the best spaces.

Name: Intelligenz Testspiel
Description:
This is just a game for 1 to 6 players to make 10 different tests and the winner is the person with the highest IQ after the 10 rounds.

In a second "variant" there you have jokers for putting them on special tests, you think you are good at to get more points.

Name: Kickoff the game
Description:
The new football card game.

Easy to learn - easy to play!

If you can play football you can play Kickoff!

Players each choose a formation card (4-4-2, 4-3-3, etc) and draw a hand of 10 cards from three categories, Defense, Midfield, Attack based on their formation,  Use Midfield cards to move the ball forward on the pitch board, use Attack cards to shoot and defend cards to Save shots.  Tackle cards, Foul Cards and a Red Card are mixed in to add "realism" to the game.

Players replenish their hand back up to 10 cards whenever they lose possesion. Score more goals than your opponent before the draw deck runs out.

Name: Quinx
Description:
An abstract strategy game from designer Joli Kansil. Players roll two dodeca, 12-sided dice colored with 3 different spots, to determine how they may place a piece on the 10×10 board. Players can play only on their own color, but the dice roll determines how many friendly or enemy pieces the new piece may be adjacent to.

The goal is to form 5 quinx. A quinx is an arrangement of 5 pieces in an X shape, as found on the 5 of a standard-pipped six-sided die. This shape is sometimes known as a quincunx, from which the game gets its name.

The dice thrown by each player are the same as found in Kansil's game Krakatoa. Each player has a pair in their color, and each die has 3 yellow, 4 red, and 5 blue spots.

Out of print for many years, this is reportedly the hardest Joli Kansil/Xanadu Leisure game to find.

Name: Wyvern Pass Not
Description:
Wyvern Pass Not is a tile placement-solitaire game for the Decktet. It is an adaptation of a flash game by Sandhill Games Ring Pass Not

You are a great mage, represented by the excuse, taming the wyvern; put it in front of yourself in a way that the little fool is standing up. As the mage you need to create a ring of protection before the wyvern breaths fire upon you. Well a wyvern, or a balrog, or whatever please you because the nature of the Decktet you could represent whatever battle, or characters, or universe that please you, well, always when the story to represent must be the creation of a protection against a superior physical or magical power.

The player must create a ring of eight tiles (Decktet cards) in a perfect circle with perfect links to win. Each link is formed by two cards that share a common suit. The player takes the tiles/cards from a drawing pool of four cards. The player can deal new cards onto the drawing pool but this will deplete its maximum number of cards by -1. If the player deplete all his drawing pool, or form a ring with not-working links, he loses.

Rules at the Decktet wiki:

http://decktet.wikidot.com/game:wyvern-pass-not

Name: Verto
Description:
Verto is an abstract board game which can be played with a Reversi set (though a 9x9 board is recommended).

Players enter stones (with their own color facing up) on empty spaces. If a stone is placed such that exactly one opponent stone is orthogonally or diagonally between the entered stone and another friendly stone, then this opponent stone is flipped and becomes a friendly stone. Then the capturing stone becomes the new starting point for another capture move and so on ...

The player who ends up with the majority of stones on the completely filled board wins the game.
